column5: Pulled this gorgeous mint condition wooden boat outta the bush while speckin today...and she floats!    I thought about strapping on the merc and takin er for a rip down the lake but figured it would serve us better as a heat source, so we sacrificed it via campfire to the brookie gods, and were rewarded with a modest bounty...    -18 this morning but my raccoon eyes tell me that spring is not far off.  Another 3-4 weeks of safe hard water fishing then the sled goes away...I hope!
Classic!  I'll give you $200 for the Safari to put towards your new Grand Caravan???
Nice Joey , should of thrown a lick of paint on that boat and she would be good as new !
Surprised the seat held him up.
You guys are such rednecks - love it LOL!
I wanted to pull him around behind the safari in it to see how well it planed out, but we didn't have a strap.  Chris no caravans in my future!!
Redneck indeed. You'd never catch me doing stuff like that.  How big was that speck you filleted? Looks around 13-14"
Hilarious, looks like you guys always have a good time fishin. Those specks sure look tasty too!
I could be wrong and according to my wife that happens quite often but, those specks look like splake.
They are natural specks.  Those fish had been laying out in the sun for hours.
Would it take a 90 Merc do you think??
Man, I love this time of the year. Great report. Looks like a blast.
